title: COURT ORDER
question: I had a bill with a Collection dept back in the early 80' 90' maybe 2001. Now it went to FTB they put a 99:legal processes on my bank acct. My bank saids its a court order from the FTB I never got any letters from them about taking me to court. Well back then I got hurt from my job and became Disabled for life. I get $860.00 a month can they take my money that I barely make a month. Now I can pay my rent or anything. I need some adviced please I really would appreaited very much.
answers:
FTB is the franchise tax board the state equivalent of the IRS. It wouldn't make sense that they would attempt to collect from a debt. You should be able to fill
Out an exemption form to avoid a bank levy or garnishment.

By FTB I assume you mean Franchise Tax Board, correct? Generally speaking, filing for bankruptcy may discharge taxes that are at least three years old, and no new assessment had been done for the past 8 calendar months. Once the bankruptcy is filed, all liens placed on your personal properties, including bank accounts, will stop. Under most states' law, income from social disability is exempt from judgment/lien/garnishment.
Unless this is for back taxes I don't see why the FTB would be involved. I am reposting this under debt settlement.
